verses.kjv: So when David was old and full of days, he made Solomon his son king over Israel.
verses.ct: When David had grown old and lived a full life, he appointed his son Solomon as king over Israel.

verses.kjv: And he gathered together all the princes of Israel, with the priests and the Levites.
verses.ct: He assembled all the leaders of Israel, along with the priests and the Levites.

verses.kjv: Now the Levites were numbered from the age of thirty years and upward: and their number by their polls, man by man, was thirty and eight thousand.
verses.ct: The Levites who were 30 years old and above were counted, and their total number, counted individually, was 38,000.

verses.kjv: Of which, twenty and four thousand were to set forward the work of the house of the LORD; and six thousand were officers and judges:
verses.ct: Of these, 24,000 were assigned to oversee the work of the LORD's house, and 6,000 served as officials and judges.

verses.kjv: Moreover four thousand were porters; and four thousand praised the LORD with the instruments which I made, said David, to praise therewith.
verses.ct: Another 4,000 were gatekeepers, and 4,000 were to praise the LORD with instruments that David said he had made for that purpose.

verses.kjv: And David divided them into courses among the sons of Levi, namely, Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
verses.ct: David organized them into divisions based on the sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.

verses.kjv: Of the Gershonites were, Laadan, and Shimei.
verses.ct: From the Gershonites came Laadan and Shimei.

verses.kjv: The sons of Laadan; the chief was Jehiel, and Zetham, and Joel, three.
verses.ct: The sons of Laadan: the leader was Jehiel, then Zetham and Joel — 3 in all.

verses.kjv: The sons of Shimei; Shelomith, and Haziel, and Haran, three. These were the chief of the fathers of Laadan.
verses.ct: The sons of Shimei: Shelomith, Haziel, and Haran — 3 in all. These were the heads of the families descended from Laadan.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Shimei were, Jahath, Zina, and Jeush, and Beriah. These four were the sons of Shimei.
verses.ct: The sons of Shimei were Jahath, Zina, Jeush, and Beriah. These 4 were the sons of Shimei.

verses.kjv: And Jahath was the chief, and Zizah the second: but Jeush and Beriah had not many sons; therefore they were in one reckoning, according to their father’s house.
verses.ct: Jahath was the leader, and Zizah was second. But Jeush and Beriah did not have many sons, so they were counted together as a single family unit.

verses.kjv: The sons of Kohath; Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel, four.
verses.ct: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel — 4 in all.

verses.kjv: The sons of Amram; Aaron and Moses: and Aaron was separated, that he should sanctify the most holy things, he and his sons for ever, to burn incense before the LORD, to minister unto him, and to bless in his name for ever.
verses.ct: The sons of Amram were Aaron and Moses. Aaron was set apart to consecrate the most holy things — he and his descendants permanently — to burn incense in the LORD's presence, to serve him, and to pronounce blessings in his name forever.

verses.kjv: Now concerning Moses the man of God, his sons were named of the tribe of Levi.
verses.ct: As for Moses, the man of God, his sons were counted as part of the tribe of Levi.

verses.kjv: The sons of Moses were, Gershom, and Eliezer.
verses.ct: The sons of Moses were Gershom and Eliezer.

verses.kjv: Of the sons of Gershom, Shebuel was the chief.
verses.ct: Among the descendants of Gershom, Shebuel was the leader.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Eliezer were, Rehabiah the chief. And Eliezer had none other sons; but the sons of Rehabiah were very many.
verses.ct: Among the descendants of Eliezer, Rehabiah was the leader. Eliezer had no other sons, but Rehabiah's descendants were very numerous.

verses.kjv: Of the sons of Izhar; Shelomith the chief.
verses.ct: Among the sons of Izhar, Shelomith was the leader.

verses.kjv: Of the sons of Hebron; Jeriah the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.
verses.ct: Among the sons of Hebron: Jeriah was the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.

verses.kjv: Of the sons of Uzziel; Micah the first, and Jesiah the second.
verses.ct: Among the sons of Uzziel: Micah was the first, and Jesiah the second.

verses.kjv: The sons of Merari; Mahli, and Mushi. The sons of Mahli; Eleazar, and Kish.
verses.ct: The sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi. The sons of Mahli were Eleazar and Kish.

verses.kjv: And Eleazar died, and had no sons, but daughters: and their brethren the sons of Kish took them.
verses.ct: Eleazar died without having any sons — only daughters. Their relatives, the sons of Kish, married them.

verses.kjv: The sons of Mushi; Mahli, and Eder, and Jeremoth, three.
verses.ct: The sons of Mushi were Mahli, Eder, and Jeremoth — 3 in all.

verses.kjv: These were the sons of Levi after the house of their fathers; even the chief of the fathers, as they were counted by number of names by their polls, that did the work for the service of the house of the LORD, from the age of twenty years and upward.
verses.ct: These were the descendants of Levi by their ancestral families — the family heads as they were counted by name, one by one — who carried out the work of serving in the LORD's house, from 20 years old and above.

verses.kjv: For David said, The LORD God of Israel hath given rest unto his people, that they may dwell in Jerusalem for ever:
verses.ct: David had said, "The LORD, the God of Israel, has given his people peace, and he has made Jerusalem his permanent home.

verses.kjv: And also unto the Levites; they shall no more carry the tabernacle, nor any vessels of it for the service thereof.
verses.ct: So the Levites will no longer need to carry the tabernacle or any of its equipment used in its service."

verses.kjv: For by the last words of David the Levites were numbered from twenty years old and above:
verses.ct: According to David's final instructions, the Levites were counted from 20 years old and above.

verses.kjv: Because their office was to wait on the sons of Aaron for the service of the house of the LORD, in the courts, and in the chambers, and in the purifying of all holy things, and the work of the service of the house of God;
verses.ct: Their role was to assist the descendants of Aaron in the service of the LORD's house — taking care of the courtyards, the rooms, the purification of all sacred items, and all the work involved in serving at God's house.

verses.kjv: Both for the shewbread, and for the fine flour for meat offering, and for the unleavened cakes, and for that which is baked in the pan, and for that which is fried, and for all manner of measure and size;
verses.ct: They were responsible for the bread of the Presence, the fine flour for grain offerings, the unleavened wafers, the baked goods, the fried offerings, and all measurements of quantity and size.

verses.kjv: And to stand every morning to thank and praise the LORD, and likewise at even;
verses.ct: They were also to stand every morning to give thanks and praise to the LORD, and to do the same every evening.

verses.kjv: And to offer all burnt sacrifices unto the LORD in the sabbaths, in the new moons, and on the set feasts, by number, according to the order commanded unto them, continually before the LORD:
verses.ct: They were to assist with all the burnt offerings presented to the LORD on Sabbaths, at New Moon festivals, and during appointed feasts, in the proper number and according to the regulations — continually in the LORD's presence.

verses.kjv: And that they should keep the charge of the tabernacle of the congregation, and the charge of the holy place, and the charge of the sons of Aaron their brethren, in the service of the house of the LORD.
verses.ct: In this way, they were to fulfill their duties at the tent of meeting, care for the holy place, and support their brothers, the descendants of Aaron, in the service of the LORD's house.
